title: Placement Matches ~ How do they work?
body:
So my curiosity has recently spiked after hearing that my friend who is new to League of Legends recently started to play ranked. He began placement matches and finished with 3 win and 7 loses where he placed in Bronze II. This shocked me at first as I thought he would place a lot lower than I'd expected. Than I began thinking, is there a certain formula or certain amount of wins which are guaranteed for you to place in a certain division. My question being; IS there a formula to determine your rank and how does that formula work?

Many Thanks, 
GetJinxedddd  
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

replies.body: My duo first time ranked went 0W/10L ended up silver 5

so i just done my placements probaly only played 40 pvp games since i mainly played bots, anyway i lost probaly like 6 straight then 1 win then 2 loss then 1 more win, so i went 2/10 first matches were around silver 1 - gold 5, then went to mid silver then finished and placed at silver 5,  maybe it seeds from your pvp elo as well? a couple of the games i duo'd with silver and bronze, in 3 games
standard placement mmr for new players is usually silver 4-5.

Based on my personal experience last season, it would seem that a single win/loss has an effect equivalent to an MMR change of approximately 2 divisions, while consecutive wins/losses will have a reduced effect on MMR. So winning 2 matches in a row might increase your MMR by about 3 divisions, while losing twice, winning one, then losing once would lower MMR by about 2-3 divisions (down by ~3 divisions, up by ~2, down by ~2-3).

I can't speak for how accurate that method is, whether it's still relevant, or what the effects other factors (like, for example, mastery grades) would be.
